entry.string: Welcome to International Classification of Traditional Medicine (ICTM)
Statistics of the most active chapters
A string that can be used to sort the children of a category. This is not the ICTM code.
The "ICTM Title" is the term for any ICTM concept (unit, entity or category) which labels the intended concept in a meaningful, unambiguous way
A concise definition which gives the user full meaning of the entity (max. 100 words)
iCAT will be updated soon to accommodate this functionality. At this time, please refrain from entering content for this parameter.
Disorder/Syndrome (WM) / 功能紊乱 /综合征 / 기능장애/증후군
Reason for Encounter / 就诊原因 / 사고
Exposure to External Causes (ICD Chapter 20) / 外因（第20章） / 외인
Any grouping of the above concept types
DRAFT HINT: Specifies the linearization in which this category should be used
Edit linearization specific sorting label only if it is different from the default sorting label
Synonyms are alternative names for the same underlying concept (e.g. common terms, medical jargon)
Inclusion terms are either synonyms of the category titles or subclasses which are not represented in the classification hierarchy
Exclusion terms help users eliminate entities that should be assigned to a different ICTM category because of differences in meaning or terminology
Small Intestine (TM) / 小肠 / 소장 / ------- 小腸 ----
Greater Yang Person / 太陽人 / 태양인
Lesser Yang Person / 少陽人 / 소양인
Greater Yin Person / 太陰人 / 태음인
Lesser Yin Person / 少陰人 / 소음인
Healthy State / 完實無病 / 완실무병
Traditional divisions of body systems used to organize codes taken from list of body systems currently used in the ICD-10
Topographic location of the body where the health-related problem can be found at the most specific level relevant to the condition selected from SNOMED-CT
DRAFT HINT: This property defines the morphologically abnormal structure that is present in characteristic for this disease
Objective diagnostic findings and subjective indications of a diseases or disorder
Investigations include anything that is done as a lab or measurement and used to diagnose the patient by the doctor
DRAFT HINT: (External) agents that identify the necessary cause(s) that must be present for an ICTM concept to occur
Causal mechanisms identify the necessary cause(s) that must be present for an ICTM concept to occur
Genomic Linkages identify necessary candidate genes and snips related to the occurrence of the ICTM concept
Outer Defense Level (Wei fen) / 證衛分 / 위분
Inner Defense Level (Qi fen) / 氣分證 / 기분
Nutrient Level (Ying fen) / 證営分 / 영분
Blood Level (Xue fen) / 血分證 / 혈분
Greater Yang Disease (Taiyang Stage) / 太阳经 / 양명병
Yang Brightness Disease (Yangming Stage) / 阳明经 / 양명병
Lesser Yang Disease (Shaoyang Stage) / 少阳经 / 소양병
Greater Yin Disease (Taiyin Stage) / 太阴经 / 태음병
Lesser Yin Disease (Shaoyin Stage) / 少阴经 / 소음병
Reverting Yin Disease (Jue Yin Stage) / 厥阴经 / 궐음병
iCAT will be updated soon to accommodate this functionality. At this time, please refrain from entering content for this parameter.
DRAFT HINT: Understanding impact other than those presented in the multiple choice list.
DRAFT HINT: Communication impact other than those presented in the multiple choice list.
Moving around outside the home and other buildings
DRAFT HINT: Mobility impact other than those presented in the multiple choice list.
Managing one's health (needs, assistance or oversight)
DRAFT HINT: SelfCare impact other than those presented in the multiple choice list.
DRAFT HINT: InterpersonalRelations impact other than those presented in the multiple choice list.
DRAFT HINT: HouseholdActivities impact other than those presented in the multiple choice list.
DRAFT HINT: SchoolActivities impact other than those presented in the multiple choice list.
DRAFT HINT: WorkActivities impact other than those presented in the multiple choice list.
Handling stress and other psychological demands
DRAFT HINT: LifeManagement impact other than those presented in the multiple choice list.
DRAFT HINT: SocialParticipation impact other than those presented in the multiple choice list.

Select the biological sex to which this category is applicable in exclusivity
Condition Usually Occurs in Mother during
Select one or more values in case the condition usually occurs in a mother

Select one or more values in case the condition usually occurs in a child
